episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of fascinating topics, including the historical use of horse-drawn monorails, the severe impact of the Great Smog of 1952 in London, an unusual temperature record in Antarctica, and the dual role of a finance minister as a court jester in Tonga.

facts.fact: The great smog of 1952 was so bad that blind people led sighted people home from the train station.
On the 24th of March 2015, the temperature in Antarctica was higher than in Malta, Madrid and Marrakesh.
Tonga's official finance minister was also its official court jester.
